channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7 in 10 office workers say they have a ‘work wife’ or ‘work husband’—here’s why experts warn they probably shouldn’t
item.description: While the quirky phrase might be shorthand between pals, it's a red flag for everyone else.

item.title: The lucky few Gen Z and millennials who broke into the housing market feel trapped in their starter homes, report says
item.description: Americans feel stuck in their first homes, tied down by high interest rates.

item.title: An Alarming Glimpse Into a Future of Historic Droughts

item.title: What went wrong at CVS? Departing CEO Karen Lynch’s reign started brilliantly, then unraveled fast
item.description: A trifecta of problems, some that started before she took the top job, ended the reign of one of the most powerful women in American business.

item.title: Italy’s winemakers face yet another threat to their future
item.description: Italy’s winemakers face climate challenges, shifting tastes, and rising debt, threatening the future of this iconic industry.

item.title: There’s a new power player at CVS after Karen Lynch’s dismissal—but he’s not CEO
item.description: Roger Farah, who worked behind the scenes to right Ralph Lauren and Tory Burch, will become Executive Chairman at CVS.

item.title: Live Updates: Hopes Dim for an Immediate Cease-Fire in Gaza

item.title: Halloween’s Mutation: From Humble Holiday to Retail Monstrosity
item.description: Americans once made their own costumes and candy. Now, the holiday has rapidly commercialized, transforming into an economic juggernaut.

item.title: U.S. ‘Fusion Cells’ Assist in Israel’s Hunt for Hamas Leaders
item.description: American commandos and intelligence officers began helping Israel soon after the Oct. 7 attacks last year.

item.title: With Unusually Forceful Words, Canada Charges India With a Criminal Conspiracy

item.title: A Soldier Chose a Radical Way to Publicize Troop Fatigue: He Deserted

item.title: 5 Provisions in China’s Panda Contracts With U.S. Zoos
item.description: Normally confidential contracts show that U.S. zoos are accepting increasingly strict terms governing panda cams and public statements.

item.title: ‘The Interview’: Mia Khalifa’s Messy World of Money, Sex and Activism
item.description: For the OnlyFans star and influencer, navigating the internet is a full-time job.

item.title: Despite Israeli Bombs and Assassinations, Hezbollah Keeps Fighting
